credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Catafalque of the Bolgonese Artist Elisabetta Sirani (1638-1665)
provenance:
From the collection of Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
ex-collection: Giovanni Piancastelli
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over red chalk on off-white laid paper
description: The artis works in a pavilion with a high dado, which is decorated with escutcheons with winged skulls. A pair of mermen holding candles flank the flight of stairs. Printed in an escutchon over the front: "HIC TERMINUS / ERET"
name: Drawing
